answers.answer: I hope so .. i just made a appointment to my dr for  monday .. im so scared knowing that it can be a start of a uti or something .. i just need a piece of mind or something
It's probably from your prenatal! Also the color of your pee weird t say could depend on the sex of your child! (:

That's probably still not enough water.  I drink 12 20oz bottles a day plus other things and according to my Dr I should be drinking way more. My pee looks like lemonade so I thought it was ok. Guess I was wrong
Yeah, that's not enough water. You need AT LEAST 4 Liters a day during pregnancy. So, almost double what you are currently drinking.

I def dont think it was a uti u would feel burning or itching. i dont think its from not drinking enough water either i hardly drink water and my urine stil only comes out alittle like lemonade and sometimes clear

4nheaven,  you're drinking WAY too much water.  You're drinking nearly two gallons of water a day - and two gallons is the standard for "overhydration" or water intoxication.Overhydration can cause an extremely dangerous drop in sodium and electrolyte levels.Can you recheck with your doctor and find out if he really truly advised you to drink even more water than that?This is a big deal for me because I ended up in the hospital with a seizure for water intox,  and I didn't drink as much as 2 gallons.

4L is approximately the equivalent of one gallon and that is exactly what my midwife advised me to drink at my last prenatal.  There shouldn't be risk of overhydration if you're following an exercise regimen and sipping the water throughout the day. My sister in law is a personal trainer/body builder and claims that water should be constantly going in an ounce or two at a time. I.e. not chugging water bottles or drinking it all in one sitting.
Im always thirsty due to my GD and I pee quite alot. My Dr says it's fine also I've got insomnia so I'm up all night. So that's all in 24hr time span plus more drinks.
Don't worry about having a uti. I had one and I was totally fine, people actually get them more often during pregnancy. It's nothing really to be afraid of.

4nheaven,  if you've got GD that isn't fully under control,  you probably should be drinking more than most women should,  since GD dehydrates you.  I was interested to learn that people with diabetes don't pee all the time because they drink so much, they drink so much because they pee all the time.  The insatiable thirst is to replace the rapid fluid loss that is caused by diabetes.I had GD also - you have ever reason to be hopeful everything will turn out great.

question: Ok so im 14 weeks pregnant .. i been watching what i eat and drink cus im affraid to gain alot of  weight during pregnancy.. So i stay hydrated by drinking 4 bottle waters during the day n drink 2 cups full sized cups of water before i sleep .. i love water .. so im thinking if im hydrated why in the world is my peee so dark like i kno tmi but its almost brown ...  when before it was clear ... always clear .. its kinda scaring me ..  cus i stay away from dyes in my food n my prenatials have no dyes or nething n this didnt happen to me in my first pregnancy pls help
title: tmi .. but my peee is super dark ...
